title: Love, Cyrus
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2TGOXMw

by malecnificenttyrus11

TJ has been ignoring Cyrus, leaving Cyrus to sulk over the lack of his presence. Frustrated and determined to cheer Cyrus up, Jonah, Andi, and Buffy decide to take Cyrus to the local fair. They put him on the Ferris Wheel to clear his head. Meanwhile, Jonah makes a phone call to an unlikely person. Will they be able to cheer Cyrus up…or is this the end of his friendship(and possibly more) with TJ?

blog.name: captainkippen
blog.title: you can be oblivious
blog.description: aaron • he/him • requests are open • fic masterlist • icon by simplycyrus

summary: “Friends Don’t” by maddie and tae prompt. Ghc pointing out how non-platonic TJs actions to Cyrus are
question: “Friends Don’t” by maddie and tae prompt. Ghc pointing out how non-platonic TJs actions to Cyrus are
answer:
SEND ME FIC PROMPTS

Friends Don’t for those who haven’t heard this quality tune.

The party is in full swing when Cyrus arrives. It’s Amber’s eighteenth birthday and somehow, using means unknown to anyone else, she managed to convince her parents to disappear for a weekend so she could celebrate with her friends. The house is full of people he recognises from other parties Andi and Amber have dragged them all to in the past. People shoot him smiles and greetings as he weaves his way through the halls. He just finished work an hour ago, so he had to drive himself here and he hadn’t had much time to get ready, but he didn’t want to show up too late. Andi and Jonah baked a cake that’s the size of a rather large baby and he can’t wait to see Amber’s face when they surprise her with it.

He heads for the kitchen first because that’s usually where he finds his friends on night’s like this, but when he gets there it’s crowded with people watching a guy tip upside down to do a keg stand. Cyrus raises himself on to his tiptoes to scan over everybody’s heads and see if he can spot TJ, and that’s when one of the drunk guys standing by the door notices him.

“Oh, hey man. It’s Cyrus, right? You looking for your boyfriend?”

“My boyfriend?” Cyrus asks, baffled. The guy must take that more as a confirmation than a question because he just nods with a big goofy grin and points his beer towards the doors to the yard.

“He was out on the deck last I saw. I think your other friends are playing beer pong.”

“Cool,” he replies, grateful he doesn’t have to track everyone down by himself now. “Thanks, man.”

“No problem!” The dude says, then turns his attention back to the keg.

Cyrus heads outside, ducking and weaving through various partygoers. He grabs a bottle of beer on his way out - he can drink tonight. Amber said they could all stay over so they don’t have drive home. The bass boosted music pounding in the house changes to something more chill when he steps outside, and he realises they must have two different sound systems set up. The yard’s been decorated with endless strings of fairy lights, cheesy pink birthday streamers and banners that read ‘HAPPY BIRTHDAY’. It’s a typical Amber-explosion of an event. Cyrus is filled with an overwhelming feeling of fondness as he takes it all in.

True to the drunk guy’s word, he finds his friends out playing beer pong by the pool. He actually hears them before he sees them; loud raucous laughter and teasing smack talk being thrown back and forth. It’s Jonah and Walker versus Buffy and Marty while Amber, Andi, TJ and Iris laze on the sunloungers watching in amusement as the others get increasingly competitive.

“Cyrus!” Amber greets him enthusiastically. He draws him into a tight hug.

“Happy birthday,” He laughs. She moves with the wobbling grace of someone tipsy on their way to drunk. “You’re having a good time then?”

“The best time!”

She releases him and he’s pulled into a cluster of back patting hugs and fist bumps by the others. He turns to TJ last and grins up at him.

“Underdog,” TJ greets him, ruffling his hair. “You got a drink?”

“Yep,” Cyrus waves the beer at him, then realises he doesn’t have a bottle opener. TJ seems to realise the same thing, and he claps him on the back.

“I’ll go grab something to open that,” He says. “Be right back.”

They watch him go as he jogs back up the steps to the kitchen and disappears inside.

“Must be nice to have your own personal butler,” Buffy teases, wiggling her eyebrow. “I wish Marty cared about me that much.” She’s been making those sorts of jokes a lot lately. Everyone has. It seems everyone has a comment on how he and TJ behave around each other, which is odd because Cyrus doesn’t see anything different in their interactions to how they’ve always been.

He rolls his eyes. “Stop. I don’t know why you keep insinuating there’s something going on between us… it’s weird. You know a guy inside called TJ my boyfriend?”

Andi snorts. “Yeah, ‘cause he basically is.”

“He is not!”

“Oh, please,” Iris chimes in. “Have you seen the way that boy looks at you? He’s crazy about you. You’re not much better with him, either. Everyone thinks you’re together because you both act like you are.”

Cyrus splutters. “We do not. We’re friends.”

Jonah makes a loud disbelieving noise. Cyrus turns to look at him with a raised eyebrow and he shrugs.

“‘Friends’ don’t run to grab each other bottle openers without being asked, bro,” he points out. “That’s purely a Cyrus-And-TJ thing.”

“And ‘friends’ don’t have entire conversations with their eyes,” Marty laughs. “Sometimes I think you guys are like… telepathic or something.”

“‘Friends’ also don’t constantly lend each other their jackets when the other looks cold,” Buffy says.

“We don’t do that that often,” Cyrus defends himself.

The others chorus, “‘That often’.”

The conversation is interrupted by TJ’s return. He takes Cyrus’ beer from him and opens the bottle easily before handing it back. Their friends shoot Cyrus meaningful looks over his shoulder. He elects to ignore them. Eventually, the others get back into their intense game of beer bong and Cyrus settles next to TJ on one of the sun loungers to talk to Iris. He has a little trouble completely focusing on the conversation, though, because he’s now distracted by what the others had said.

Do he and TJ really behave like a couple that much? He’s hyper-aware of their shoulders and knees pressed together and that’s how he realises how close they’re sitting to one another. Maybe if they were just friends they’d sit further apart. He’s unsure… he hasn’t thought about how close he sits to people before. He and TJ have always sat this close when they’re together. It’s nice. It’s comforting. Is it really that unusual to want to be close to your friends? TJ brushes a bit of glitter from Cyrus’ cheek while joking with Iris about something that happened at the gym earlier in the week. Does TJ touch him like that a lot too? Casual affection is normal, isn’t it? Cyrus has always felt comfortable exchanging little touches with TJ. He likes it when TJ ruffles his hair or places his hands gently on Cyrus’ waist to move him out the way sometimes or when they cuddle during movie nights. They’re just close. There’s nothing wrong with that.

He watches as TJ laughs at something Iris says and it hits him all at once. He thinks about how he gets distracted when other people mention TJ’s name in conversation, about how he could talk about TJ for days if he wanted. He thinks about all the times TJ has called him at two am for no particular reason, just because he felt like saying hi, and the conversations that often lasted for hours afterwards. He thinks about the number of times he’s told TJ off for cancelling other plans just to hang out with him, and how many times TJ’s argued with him about Cyrus deliberately ordering food he knows TJ will like instead of just food for him when they’re out. He thinks about picking croutons out of TJ’s salads while TJ takes his olives. Memories of TJ turning up the radio when one of Cyrus’ favourite songs came on in the car floor his thoughts. They spend all their time together. Cyrus knows TJ like the back of his own hand and he’s pretty sure TJ knows him just as well. He misses him when he isn’t around.

He wonders how he missed all of this before it was pointed out to him.

*

“Hey, you okay?” TJ asks later when it’s just the two of them left by the pool. The girls left to dance in the living room and Jonah dragged the guys off to challenge more people to dumb drinking games. Cyrus has his shoes off and his feet in the water, leaning back against TJ’s knees. “You’ve been quiet tonight.”

“Have I? Oh. Just tired from work, I guess,” Cyrus says, sheepishly.

TJ leans forward and runs a hand through his hair. “You sure?”

Cyrus means to say ‘I’m fine’ and carry on like normal, but he’s had a few drinks now and his lips weren’t that tightly sealed to begin with, so what spills out instead is “Are we more than friends?”

There’s a moment of silence and TJ drops his hand away. Cyrus wonders if he’s just ruined several years of friendship in a sentence because he was too dumb to keep his mouth shut.

“Do you want to be?”

Cyrus twists around to face him. TJ’s looking back at him with a blank expression carefully crafted on his face. Unfortunately for him, Cyrus knows that that face means he’s currently dealing with emotions he doesn’t know how to express verbally.

“I think I do,” Cyrus admits quietly. “I think maybe we’ve been on the verge of more than friends for a while now.”

“What made you bring it up now, then?”

He shrugs. “I guess… I don’t know. I guess I just realised how much I miss you when you’re not around. I kind of want to be around you all the time.

There’s another moment of worrying silence, and then TJ speaks.

“You know I want to tell you everything all the time,” he says. “Everything that happens in my day, big or small, I want to talk to you about it. Usually, that’s what I end up doing. And when I see something cute in a shop window, or one of the kids does something funny at work, the first person I think of is always you because I’m thinking ‘man, Cyrus would love this’.”

“TJ-”

“That time you went to the hospital because you broke your ankle?” TJ continues, putting a hand up to indicate Cyrus shouldn’t interrupt him. “When Buffy told me what happened I almost threw up I was so worried about you.”

You drew roses on my cast, Cyrus thinks fondly.

“And the swingset is my favourite place in the whole world now, probably, ‘cause I know when I go there you’ve got my back. Every. Single. Time. And I’ve got yours. You always listen. You’ve never judged me. You’re the only one who ever really encourages me to do better. I’m a better person when I’m with you. So… yeah, I think we’re more than friends.”

“Can I speak now?”

TJ nods.

“I think I’m in love with you.”

“Oh, thank God,” TJ leans in close, and tips Cyrus’ face up with a gentle finger to look him in the eye. “I was worried it was just me.”

Cyrus smiles into the kiss. It’s the best party he’s ever been to in his life.

“Oh, please,” Iris chimes in. “Have you seen the way that boy looks at you? He’s crazy about you. You’re not much better with him, either. Everyone thinks you’re together because you both act like you are.”

Cyrus splutters. “We do not. We’re friends.”

Jonah makes a loud disbelieving noise. Cyrus turns to look at him with a raised eyebrow and he shrugs.

“‘Friends’ don’t run to grab each other bottle openers without being asked, bro,” he points out. “That’s purely a Cyrus-And-TJ thing.”

“And ‘friends’ don’t have entire conversations with their eyes,” Marty laughs. “Sometimes I think you guys are like… telepathic or something.”

“‘Friends’ also don’t constantly lend each other their jackets when the other looks cold,” Buffy says.

“We don’t do that that often,” Cyrus defends himself.

The others chorus, “‘That often’.”

The conversation is interrupted by TJ’s return. He takes Cyrus’ beer from him and opens the bottle easily before handing it back. Their friends shoot Cyrus meaningful looks over his shoulder. He elects to ignore them. Eventually, the others get back into their intense game of beer bong and Cyrus settles next to TJ on one of the sun loungers to talk to Iris. He has a little trouble completely focusing on the conversation, though, because he’s now distracted by what the others had said.

Do he and TJ really behave like a couple that much? He’s hyper-aware of their shoulders and knees pressed together and that’s how he realises how close they’re sitting to one another. Maybe if they were just friends they’d sit further apart. He’s unsure… he hasn’t thought about how close he sits to people before. He and TJ have always sat this close when they’re together. It’s nice. It’s comforting. Is it really that unusual to want to be close to your friends? TJ brushes a bit of glitter from Cyrus’ cheek while joking with Iris about something that happened at the gym earlier in the week. Does TJ touch him like that a lot too? Casual affection is normal, isn’t it? Cyrus has always felt comfortable exchanging little touches with TJ. He likes it when TJ ruffles his hair or places his hands gently on Cyrus’ waist to move him out the way sometimes or when they cuddle during movie nights. They’re just close. There’s nothing wrong with that.

He watches as TJ laughs at something Iris says and it hits him all at once. He thinks about how he gets distracted when other people mention TJ’s name in conversation, about how he could talk about TJ for days if he wanted. He thinks about all the times TJ has called him at two am for no particular reason, just because he felt like saying hi, and the conversations that often lasted for hours afterwards. He thinks about the number of times he’s told TJ off for cancelling other plans just to hang out with him, and how many times TJ’s argued with him about Cyrus deliberately ordering food he knows TJ will like instead of just food for him when they’re out. He thinks about picking croutons out of TJ’s salads while TJ takes his olives. Memories of TJ turning up the radio when one of Cyrus’ favourite songs came on in the car floor his thoughts. They spend all their time together. Cyrus knows TJ like the back of his own hand and he’s pretty sure TJ knows him just as well. He misses him when he isn’t around.

He wonders how he missed all of this before it was pointed out to him.

*

“Hey, you okay?” TJ asks later when it’s just the two of them left by the pool. The girls left to dance in the living room and Jonah dragged the guys off to challenge more people to dumb drinking games. Cyrus has his shoes off and his feet in the water, leaning back against TJ’s knees. “You’ve been quiet tonight.”

“Have I? Oh. Just tired from work, I guess,” Cyrus says, sheepishly.

TJ leans forward and runs a hand through his hair. “You sure?”

Cyrus means to say ‘I’m fine’ and carry on like normal, but he’s had a few drinks now and his lips weren’t that tightly sealed to begin with, so what spills out instead is “Are we more than friends?”

There’s a moment of silence and TJ drops his hand away. Cyrus wonders if he’s just ruined several years of friendship in a sentence because he was too dumb to keep his mouth shut.

“Do you want to be?”

Cyrus twists around to face him. TJ’s looking back at him with a blank expression carefully crafted on his face. Unfortunately for him, Cyrus knows that that face means he’s currently dealing with emotions he doesn’t know how to express verbally.

“I think I do,” Cyrus admits quietly. “I think maybe we’ve been on the verge of more than friends for a while now.”

“What made you bring it up now, then?”

He shrugs. “I guess… I don’t know. I guess I just realised how much I miss you when you’re not around. I kind of want to be around you all the time.

There’s another moment of worrying silence, and then TJ speaks.

“You know I want to tell you everything all the time,” he says. “Everything that happens in my day, big or small, I want to talk to you about it. Usually, that’s what I end up doing. And when I see something cute in a shop window, or one of the kids does something funny at work, the first person I think of is always you because I’m thinking ‘man, Cyrus would love this’.”

“TJ-”

“That time you went to the hospital because you broke your ankle?” TJ continues, putting a hand up to indicate Cyrus shouldn’t interrupt him. “When Buffy told me what happened I almost threw up I was so worried about you.”

You drew roses on my cast, Cyrus thinks fondly.

“And the swingset is my favourite place in the whole world now, probably, ‘cause I know when I go there you’ve got my back. Every. Single. Time. And I’ve got yours. You always listen. You’ve never judged me. You’re the only one who ever really encourages me to do better. I’m a better person when I’m with you. So… yeah, I think we’re more than friends.”

“Can I speak now?”

TJ nods.

“I think I’m in love with you.”

“Oh, thank God,” TJ leans in close, and tips Cyrus’ face up with a gentle finger to look him in the eye. “I was worried it was just me.”

Cyrus smiles into the kiss. It’s the best party he’s ever been to in his life.

summary: HC thoughts on how TJ would deal with still wanting to play sports and being gay? Do you think he'd struggle with any...
question: HC thoughts on how TJ would deal with still wanting to play sports and being gay? Do you think he'd struggle with any conflict/try and hide his relationship with Cyrus in the closet (school sports are still so full of toxic masculinity) like being captain seems to be one of the few things  (besides) Cyrus that makes him happy. I know it's meant to be a more optimistic show but I feel it's something I wish the show could have dealt with. How do you think he'd overcome the issues relating to this?
answer:
I think he wouldn’t purposely go out of his way to hide the fact he’s gay from the team, but wouldn’t go out of his way to tell them. Unless his teammates are known homophobes. In that case he’d intentionally hide it for his own safety.

And honestly, he might just resort to beating anyone up that’s teasing him or Cyrus for being gay. Then people would be sure not to mess with him.

Also I agree with you, it’d be interesting for the show to tackle mild homophobia (nothing too serious though cuz triggers and stuff) but unfortunately there’s no way Disney would draw that much attention to their gay characters. Not yet anyway.

blog.title: you can be oblivious
blog.description: aaron • he/him • requests are open • fic masterlist • icon by simplycyrus

summary: hi I love your writing so much and you're super talented !!! could you write a fic about tyrus and a long distance relationship?...
question: hi I love your writing so much and you're super talented !!! could you write a fic about tyrus and a long distance relationship? (a continuation of the camping ones I guess?). maybe them visiting each other or finally being able to move in with each other after college or whatever hdjsjsjs thanks <3
answer:
SEND ME FIC PROMPTS

Thank you so much!

Cyrus couldn’t bite back a smile as he picked up the incoming call from TJ. He knew exactly what this conversation was going to be because TJ was almost half an hour late to meet him now.

“You’re late,” He sung into the phone.

TJ’s was tinny and crackled through the phone, but the annoyance in his tone came through clear as day. “I know. Your campus is like one big maze. I’ve been walking in circles for like an hour now.”

“Why didn’t you just text me to come find you?” He knew why. It was because TJ was as stubborn as they come and unwilling to ask for help most of the time, especially when it came to directions. He had this weird attitude towards maps that suggested he knew better than them, but really Cyrus was pretty sure he just found them too confusing. Even with Google maps telling them out loud where to go TJ has gotten lost before. It was a talent of his.

“I thought I had it down,” TJ grumbled. “Why is nothing here signposted?”

“Okay,” Cyrus grabbed his keys from the top of his dresser and slipped on some shoes. “Describe your location, I’m coming to find you.”

It took Cyrus ten minutes to find TJ. Fortunately, he was only a little way across campus rather than lost somewhere down near Greek Row or the library. From a distance, he looked grumpy, but as Cyrus walked towards him he lifted his head and a smile blossomed across his face when he spotted him. Cyrus forced himself not to run towards him, just walking at a slightly higher than average speed, but somehow they still managed to collide so hard that the force of their hug almost winded both of them.

“Hi,” Cyrus sighed happily into TJ’s chest. “I’ve missed you.”

“I missed you too,” TJ mumbled, pressing a kiss to the top of his head. “I hate being far away.”

“It sucks,” He pulled back to stretch up and give TJ a quick kiss. It took all his strength not to real him in for a proper one, but there was a time and a place for that and he didn’t want any of his professors to witness him practically mauling his boyfriend. “How was the drive?”

He pulled away and TJ bent down to pick up the duffle bag by his feet. The sight of the bag made Cyrus incredibly happy. It was an old one, the one that TJ had always used to use for camping, but now it signified special weekends visiting one another or trips down to the lake when they were back at home.

“It was okay,” TJ shrugged. “Long. Did you know drivers here are real passive aggressive?”

Cyrus laughed as they started walking back towards his dorm. “Maybe they wouldn’t be so much if you drove like a sane person. How many people did you cut off today?”

TJ grinned and shoved into him playfully, but his silence confirmed Cyrus’ suspicions. Terrible at directions and a terrible driver. Why did Cyrus find that so endearing?

“And how was the motel?”

“Decent. No bed bugs, no murderers, just noisy neighbours. It was fine for just the night, but I’m looking forward to your bed.”

“It’s just a generic dorm bed.”

“It’ll have you in though, won’t it?”

Cyrus rolled his eyes. “What do you wanna do later? Campus tour? I know all the great spots for having a panic attack. What about dinner? There’s a diner across the street from us that does great waffles. I know how much you love waffles. Or! We could go and catch a movie, there’s this little independent-”

“Cyrus,” TJ interrupted with a fond grin, sensing an oncoming ramble. “I’m okay with whatever. I’m here to see you, that’s all that matters. You don’t have to think up an entire itinerary to keep me entertained. I’m happy as long as I’m with you.”

Truth be told, Cyrus had been a little worried that after not seeing TJ for a few months maybe his boyfriend would’ve lost interest. He didn’t want him to drive for twelve hours just to have a boring weekend and decide that he and Cyrus didn’t fit together well anymore. At TJ’s reassurance, he let out a relieved breath and smiled a sunny smile back at him.

“Oh. Okay then… but I really do think you’d like the waffles.”

“Well, let’s get waffles then.”

TJ took his hand then, interlocking their fingers and giving it a comforting squeeze. It was gestures like that which reminded Cyrus that TJ knew him better than anybody else in the whole world. He couldn’t imagine not having him in his life. Not for the first time he wondered what their hands would look like wearing matching rings.

title: Smitten Kippen
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2D0uo8o

by malecnificenttyrus11

Cyrus and T.J. come up with a plan to persuade Buffy to rejoin the basketball team. Reluctantly, Buffy agrees to play a one-on-one game with TJ. After she wins, Cyrus is almost positive she’ll rejoin the team. When Buffy still refuses…how will Cyrus and TJ react to their failed plan? And will TJ get caught being blatantly obvious about his feelings for Cyrus?

  • Rating: General Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Characters: Cyrus Goodman, T.J. Kippen, Buffy Driscoll
